Wrong, wrong, wrong. This video host has no idea what he is talking about. 
Information that he presents is mostly incorrect and heavily editorialized. 
The majority of the footage shown is from manned aircraft engagements. It's 
interesting that when a fighter jet drops a bomb on some bunker from twenty 
thousand feet, the pilot is regarded as a hero and the mission is a big 
success story on the news (see media coverage of Desert Storm). Why is it 
that the same bomb dropped from the same pilot in the Nevada desert creates 
all this controversy? Neither pilot is in any real imminent danger. The 
pilot in Nevada has better cameras to identify his target and more time to 
wait for the right moment to drop the bomb. He's using a more efficient 
tool for the mission. Why do media sources focus on the tool being used and 
not the mission? I would speculate that it has something to do with the 
fact that controversy sells. The word "Drone" is very controversial and has 
probably made a lot of money over the years. The fact that the media still
